intro: Urera filiformis, commonly known as the slender urera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Urera filiformis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
